unnormalised: Delhiites, prep yourselves for a meteorological rollercoaster ride! Our beloved IMD (India Meteorological Department) is predicting a scorcher of a summer this year, starting, well, pretty much now! Seems like the sun has already preponed its arrival.
normalised: Delhiites, prep yourselves for a meteorological rollercoaster ride! Our beloved I-M-D (India Meteorological Department) is predicting a scorcher of a summer this year, starting, well, pretty much now! Seems like the sun has already preponed its arrival.

unnormalised: Forget the gentle breeze and pleasant evenings we were promised. The forecast says we're looking at temps consistently hovering around 40°C, peaking at a delightful (not!) 45°C by mid-May. That’s roughly 113°F for all you folks still clinging to Fahrenheit. Time to dig out those ACs, coolers, and that weird sun hat Auntiji gifted you last Diwali.
normalised: Forget the gentle breeze and pleasant evenings we were promised. The forecast says we're looking at temps consistently hovering around forty degree celsius, peaking at a delightful (not!) forty five degree celsius by mid-May. That’s roughly one hundred and thirteen degree fahrenheit for all you folks still clinging to Fahrenheit. Time to dig out those A-C's, coolers, and that weird sun hat Auntiji gifted you last Diwali.

unnormalised: And the humidity? Oh, the humidity! Imagine stepping out of your house feeling like you’ve walked straight into a sauna… a sauna filled with pollution and auto-rickshaw exhaust. The met department forecasts humidity levels to reach a sticky 75% on particularly heinous days. Remember that time you complained about the Mumbai humidity? Consider this Delhi's revenge.

The met department forecasts humidity levels to reach a sticky seventy five percent on particularly heinous days. Remember that time you complained about the Mumbai humidity? Consider this Delhi's revenge.

unnormalised: But wait, there's more! As if the relentless sun wasn't enough, we also have the "loo" to contend with. These hot, dry winds will be sweeping across the city from, oh, approximately 11:00 AM to 6:00 PM every day. It's basically like walking through a giant hair dryer, but instead of leaving you with bouncy, voluminous locks, it just leaves you feeling parched and vaguely dusty.

unnormalised: Of course, no Indian weather forecast is complete without the obligatory "possibility of thunderstorms." These brief respites from the heat are usually announced with great fanfare, only to result in a few scattered drops of rain and a whole lot of traffic jams. The next chance of thunder is expected around the 28/04/2024. Don't hold your breath; maybe just a damp towel.

unnormalised: So, what's the takeaway? Arm yourselves! Stock up on nimbu pani, wear light-colored clothes, and avoid stepping out during peak hours (12 PM - 4 PM) unless absolutely necessary. And if you do venture out, remember to hydrate, hydrate, hydrate! Maybe even carry a small spray bottle of water to mist yourself periodically. It's not glamorous, but it's survival.

unnormalised: And remember, this too shall pass. Eventually. Maybe by July 1st, when the monsoon season finally decides to grace us with its presence. Until then, stay cool, stay hydrated, and try to find the humor in the face of impending heatstroke. At least we can all bond over our shared suffering, right? The suffering will be between now and 30/06/2024 mostly. Oh and maybe plan that trip to the Himalayas!
